properties.areaDesc: Waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Gale Warning issued January 8 at 3:32AM PST until January 9 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Small Craft Advisory through Wednesday evening,
southwest winds 20 to 30 kt with steep seas 9 to 14 feet at 12
seconds. For the Gale Warning period, northwest winds 25 to 35
kt with gusts up to 45 kt and seas 12 to 14 feet at 11 seconds.
For the Hazardous Seas Warning, very steep and hazardous seas
around 14 feet at 10 seconds expected. For the Hazardous Seas
Watch, very steep and hazardous seas 20 to 25 feet at 16 seconds
possible.

* WHERE...All hazards will affect all of the area except for the
Gale Warning, which is in effect for all except the northeastern
quarter of the area.

* WHEN...For the Small Craft Advisory, until 4 AM PST Thursday. For
the Gale Warning, from 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST
Thursday. For the Hazardous Seas Warning, from 4 AM to 10 AM PST
Thursday. For the Hazardous Seas Watch, from Friday afternoon
through Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...During the advisory period, small boats and
inexperienced mariners could encounter conditions that could
jeopardize safety. During the warning and watch periods, strong
winds and very steep seas could damage or displace fishing gear.
Very steep and hazardous seas could capsize or damage vessels.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid strong winds and very steep
seas. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe conditions.

A Small Craft Advisory means that winds and seas will create a
potential hazard to smaller vessels and inexperienced mariners.

A Gale Warning means winds of 34 to 47 knots are imminent or
occurring. Operating a vessel in gale conditions requires
experience and properly equipped vessels. It is highly recommended
that mariners without the proper experience seek safe harbor prior
to the onset of gale conditions.

A Hazardous Seas Warning means very steep and hazardous sea
conditions are imminent or occurring. Recreational boaters should
remain in port, or take shelter until waves subside.  Commercial
vessels should prepare for rough seas and consider remaining in
port or taking shelter in port until hazardous seas subside.

A Hazardous Seas Watch is issued when the risk of very steep and
hazardous seas has significantly increased, but the specific
timing and/or location is still uncertain. It is intended to
provide additional lead time for mariners who may wish to
consider altering their plans.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST THURSDAY... ...GALE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
